title: Enhancing e-Learning Practical Skills: TPACK-Integrated Instructional Design Course for Pre-Service Biology Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Systematically apply the TPACK framework to biology lesson design to enhance technology-integrated instructional planning capabilities
Develop three or more creative instructional models combining educational content, pedagogical methods, and technological tools

Over a 6-month course, learners write weekly reflective journals, incorporate at least three peer feedback sessions, and analyze interactions among TPACK sub-elements (technological knowledge, content knowledge, pedagogical knowledge) through three or more specific cases (e.g., designing digital tool-integrated lessons)
Apply five or more digital educational tools (e.g., AR biology visualization apps, collaboration platforms) operable in limited mobile environments to actual lesson scenarios

Learners analyze three peer-teaching videos using the TPACK evaluation rubric (integration criteria for technology, pedagogy, and content knowledge) across its three domains (technology, pedagogy, content), and submit a report proposing at least two specific improvement strategies per domain

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
